contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox nrhp | name = Wheatley Place Historic District | nrhp_type = hd | designated_other1 = Dallas Landmark | designated_other1_date = October 24, 2000 | designated_other1_number = | image = | caption = | location= [[Dallas, Texas]] | locmapin = Texas | area = | built =1916 | architect= | architecture = [[American Craftsman|Bungalow/Craftsman]] | added = March 23, 1995 | governing_body = Private | mpsub=East and South Dallas MPS | refnum=95000331 <ref name="nris">{{NRISref|2007a}}</ref> }} '''Wheatley Place''' is a neighborhood in [[south Dallas|south]] [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]], [[Texas]] ([[United States|USA]]) that is designated as a [[Dallas Landmark|Dallas Landmark District]] and [[National Register of Historic Places|National Historic District]]. by the city. Included among the buildings that compose the historic district is the home of Dallas [[American civil rights movement|civil rights]] pioneer, [[Juanita Craft]].<!--Admittedly, this needs work. I can't find a list of buildings online anywhere... --> Predominantly constructed as a neighborhood for [[African American]]s, the area was named for [[Phillis Wheatley]], an African American poet from the 18th century. The [[Dallas City Council]] designated Wheatley Place as a Historic District on 25 October 2000. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Dallas Neighborhoods|selected=southdallas}} {{Dallas}} {{coord missing|Texas}} [[Category:Populated places in Texas with African American majority populations]] [[Category:National Register of Historic Places in Dallas County, Texas]] [[Category:Historic districts in Texas]] [[Category:Dallas Landmarks]] {{Dallas-stub}} {{DallasCountyTX-geo-stub}}
